channel.title: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works
channel.description:
i made a new appeal and i am using it on one of my banned accounts. i already made the appeal and am now waiting for when it is over. here is the request i used.
Dear [s]Jagex[/s], i did not autotrain, my younger jappenesse brother was playing it for me all day. he does not speak full english so he probally wouldn't respawn to any players. im sorry for this inconvienience and i wont let my little younger jappenesse brother use my computer anymore. so please unban me so i can get back to runescape so i can hangout with my friends. thank you
so do you think this will work? lol

item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:30, topic:303236”]They actually do read appeals, trust me.

Automated responses come from programs like shortkeys.

They just type -no for example, and something will come up.

When I type:- info
Hi %%user%%! What seems to be your problem today?

It will insert the username of the person as well, just for example. They can use this and essentially be coined as ‘bots’[/quote]
Yeah but they’re still gay

Read full topic

item.source: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works

item.title: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:21, topic:303236”]Just appealed a year-long mute on my level 125 with this:

You have made a mistake.

What I said was completely sarcastic in nature, and to even suggest that it was an attempt at fraudulent behaviour is utterly fallacious.

I made absolutely no attempt to illicitly acquire anything of value (player’s trust or ‘tangible’ items), and merely did it to mock you - you do deserve it, and the fact that one of you monkeys has muted my account for a year hits that point straight home.

The only thing harmed by my statement was Jagex’s pride. Take it with a pinch of salt, suck it up and maybe even consider fixing the problem so I don’t feel the need to rip you guys off.
The average player doesn’t see through your bullshit, but I certainly do.

If it wasn’t obvious enough to the airheads that you employ, I was having a go at your company for suggesting that your systems are infallible (read: perfect, god-like, incorruptible).
Such a claim is merely dishonest; propagating such a lie makes Jagex a dishonest company.

Without wax,
Dan

I win. You guys all need to learn how to have some fun at their expense, honestly.
If they review what I said within the context of the conversation (which was about how their macro detection system is so perfect, rofl) then they’ll have no choice but to lift the mute.
Don’t care in either case, been cold turkey for ~20 days and only went online to tell friends that I was pissing off for a long time.

For the record, this is what they nabbed me for:

[quote]
lothy’s account: [clan] hi, we are jagex and we don’t believe in the potential for false positive
[/quote][/quote]lold irl

rep++ m8

Read full topic
item.source: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works

item.title: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“soul raever, post:20, topic:303236”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=399484.msg2969666#msg2969666 date=1253871649]
What I don’t understand is the whole ‘Apologise’ option.
They never EVER accept your apology and let you off, so why do they expect you to apologise?
Even minor offences stand (on first occasions), despite making an apology.
[/quote]

i had an account come put of a perm ban :)[/quote]

Me too, I actually spoke to several human mods about this.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy

@lothy wrote:

Just appealed a year-long mute on my level 125 with this:

You have made a mistake.

What I said was completely sarcastic in nature, and to even suggest that it was an attempt at fraudulent behaviour is utterly fallacious.

I made absolutely no attempt to illicitly acquire anything of value (player’s trust or ‘tangible’ items), and merely did it to mock you - you do deserve it, and the fact that one of you monkeys has muted my account for a year hits that point straight home.

The only thing harmed by my statement was Jagex’s pride. Take it with a pinch of salt, suck it up and maybe even consider fixing the problem so I don’t feel the need to rip you guys off.
The average player doesn’t see through your bullshit, but I certainly do.

If it wasn’t obvious enough to the airheads that you employ, I was having a go at your company for suggesting that your systems are infallible (read: perfect, god-like, incorruptible).
Such a claim is merely dishonest; propagating such a lie makes Jagex a dishonest company.

Without wax,
Dan

I win. You guys all need to learn how to have some fun at their expense, honestly.
If they review what I said within the context of the conversation (which was about how their macro detection system is so perfect, rofl) then they’ll have no choice but to lift the mute.
Don’t care in either case, been cold turkey for ~20 days and only went online to tell friends that I was pissing off for a long time.

For the record, this is what they nabbed me for:

lothy's account: [clan] hi, we are jagex and we don't believe in the potential for false positive

item.source: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works

item.title: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Appeal Date: 02-Aug-2009
Close Date: 20-Sep-2009

Thank you for wasting some time sending in your offence appeal - you obviously care about your account. It's too bad that we don't, and are therefore sending you this automated message. Waste some more time reading the rules, because we said you should.

At Jagex we don’t really examine any offences at all. We just tell you this, because we’ve assumed that you’re 12 and won’t be able to differentiate between a completely unpersonalised automatic message template and something that has actually been written by a human.
We are so confident with this approach, in fact, that we don’t even place your account name in the automated messages that we reply with. We’d rather increase the longevity of our computers by minimising SQL transactions to acquire such unimportant details.

Thank you for sending in your offence appeal - you obviously care about your account, and making sure that you read our rules can help to ensure that you can avoid this situation happening again.

At Jagex, we examine offences and offence appeals very carefully before we come to our final decision.

In this instance, we have found that you were responsible for this offence, and therefore it will remain on your account.

We want you, and every other player, to be positively engaged in our community and the game - if you continue to break our rules, you may reach a point where you are limited to Quick Chat, or even excluded from the game on this account, or any other accounts you have.

What do you do now?

Go here to have a good read of the Rules of Conduct, there is also good advice on ensuring your account is kept secure in our Safety & Security Guidelines, located in the ‘Customer Support’ section of our website (www.runescape.com or www.funorb.com).

Have fun - enjoy the community and the game - and please don’t spoil the experience of your fellow gamers.

Sincerely,

Jagex Customer Support

i was hoping lothy’s rant would of been a get out of jail free card.

Read full topic

item.title: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:9, topic:303236”]Why would you not say;

Dear fags,

I have an older cousin whose always loved my account. I showed him my great stats and items a while back. He used to live in Germany and always played the German version. He came to live with us to go to school a month ago. Since then he’s been trying to steal my account. He used a keystroke recorder on my computer and got a hold of my password. Since my rs homepage is set to English by default, he could not find the German option so he had to go with english. He thought he had my account for good and spend along time training and earning money. He does not know english so he would not respond to anybody. Then I received my account back after talking to my parents about him. I am sorry and have made my password much harder to find and installed an anti-virus program. By the way I support the Runescape security usb so if you ever release it (I hope you do), then I’ll be the first customer.

Please take some of your time to review my appeal.[/quote]Well, that was better then what the original poster said, but it would still get declined, lol.

Read full topic
item.source: Made a new macro ban appeal seeing if it works
